_header: I would not spare for to speak wist I to speed
Versification: — Thirty long lines in groups ranging from a couplet to six mono-rhyming lines; written as short lines in which even-numbered lines rhyme, abcb to abcbdbebfbgb — alliteration
_description: Laurence Minot, The Defeat of the Spaniards — five 6-line stanzas

BlCottGalEIX.First Lines:
I wald noght spare forto spekewist I to spedeof wight men with
                    wapinand worthly in wedeþat now er driuen to daleand ded all
                    þaire dede…
BlCottGalEIX.Last Lines:
…new lare sall ȝe leresir Edward to loutfor when
                    ȝe stode in ȝowre strenkithȝe war allto stout
BlCottGalEIX.Attributed Title:
How king Edward & his men ȝe / met with þe spaniardes in
                    þe see (rubric, by scribe, f. 56vb)
